chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
D: cpo
s: chain D

Goal:
chain_axiom [Pred x | x = bot \/ x \In s]

Premises:
chain_axiom : forall T : poset, Pred T -> Prop
Notation bot := @CPO.bot
Record chain (T : poset) : Type := Chain { pred_of : Pred T; _ : chain_axiom pred_of } Arguments Chain [T pred_of]
List.In : forall A : Type, A -> seq A -> Prop
Pred = fun T : Type => T -> Prop : Type -> Type Arguments Pred _%type_scope
image_chainP : forall (T1 T2 : poset) (s : chain T1) (f : T1 -> T2), monotone f -> chain_axiom [Pred x2 | exists x1 : T1, x2 = f x1 /\ x1 \In s]
In_cons : forall (T : Type) (y : T) (s : seq T) (x : T), x \In y :: s < -> x = y \/ x \In s
Mem_map : forall (T T' : Type) (f : T -> T') (x : T) (s : seq T), x \In s -> f x \In [seq f i | i <- s]
Mem_cat : forall (T : Type) (x : T) (s1 s2 : seq T), x \In s1 ++ s2 < -> x \In s1 \/ x \In s2
botP : forall (D : cpo) (x : D), bot <== x
sup_closed = fun T : lattice => [Pred s | forall d : Pred_Class, d <=p s -> sup d \In s] : forall T : lattice, Simpl_Pred (Pred T) Arguments sup_closed {T}
InE : forall T : Type, (forall x y : T, x \In [:: y] <-> x = y) * (forall (y : T) (s : seq T) (x : T), x \In y :: s <-> x = y \/ x \In s) * (forall (T0 : Type) (x : T0) (p : Simpl_Pred T0), (x \In p) = p x)
sub_asym : forall (T : poset) (s : Pred T) (x : {x : T | x \In s}) (y : {x0 : T | x0 \In s}), sub_leq x y -> sub_leq y x -> x = y
Simpl_PredE : forall (T : Type) (p : Pred T), p <~> [Pred x | p x]
sub_leq : forall (T : poset) (s : Pred T), {x : T | x \In s} -> {x : T | x \In s} -> Prop
sup_appE : forall (A : Type) (B : lattice) (s : Pred (A -> B)) (x : A), sup s x = sup [Pred y | exists f : A -> B, f \In s /\ y = f x]
sup_dappE : forall (A : Type) (B : A -> lattice) (s : Pred (dfunLattice B)) (x : A), sup s x = sup [Pred y | exists f : dfunLattice B, f \In s /\ y = f x]
sub_refl : forall (T : poset) (s : Pred T) (x : {x : T | x \In s}), sub_leq x x
limP : forall (D : cpo) (s : chain D) (x : D), x \In s -> x <== lim s
sub_trans : forall (T : poset) (s : Pred T) (x : {x : T | x \In s}) (y z : {x0 : T | x0 \In s}), sub_leq x y -> sub_leq y z -> sub_leq x z
Chain : forall (T : poset) (pred_of : Pred T), chain_axiom pred_of -> chain T
PredC = fun (T : Type) (p : Pred T) => [Pred x | xPredC p x] : forall T : Type, Pred T -> Simpl_Pred T Arguments PredC {T}%type_scope
CPOMixin : forall (T : poset) (mx_bot : T) (mx_lim : chain T -> T), (forall x : T, mx_bot <== x) -> (forall (s : chain T) (x : T), x \In s -> x <== mx_lim s) -> (forall (s : chain T) (x : T), (forall y : T, y \In s -> y <== x) -> mx_lim s <== x) -> CPO.mixin_of T
PredI = fun (T : Type) (p1 p2 : Pred T) => [Pred x | xPredI p1 p2 x] : forall T : Type, Pred T -> Pred T -> Simpl_Pred T Arguments PredI {T}%type_scope
PredU = fun (T : Type) (p1 p2 : Pred T) => [Pred x | xPredU p1 p2 x] : forall T : Type, Pred T -> Pred T -> Simpl_Pred T Arguments PredU {T}%type_scope
PredD = fun (T : Type) (p1 p2 : Pred T) => [Pred x | xPredD p1 p2 x] : forall T : Type, Pred T -> Pred T -> Simpl_Pred T Arguments PredD {T}%type_scope
Image_mem : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (P : Pred A) (x : A), x \In P -> f x \In [Image f i | i <- P]
Mem_Seq1 : forall (T : Type) (x y : T), x \In [:: y] < -> x = y
Record mixin_of (T : poset) : Type := Mixin { mx_bot : Poset.sort T; mx_lim : chain T -> T; _ : forall x : T, mx_bot <== x; _ : forall (s : chain T) (x : T), x \In s -> x <== mx_lim s; _ : forall (s : chain T) (x : T), (forall y : T, y \In s -> y <== x) -> mx_lim s <== x } Arguments CPO.Mixin [T mx_bot] [mx_lim]%function_scope (_ _ _)%function_scope
subPosetMixin : forall (T : poset) (s : Pred T), Poset.mixin_of {x : T | x \In s}
Preim = fun (T rT : Type) (f : T -> rT) (d : Pred rT) => [Pred x | xPreim f d x] : forall T rT : Type, (T -> rT) -> Pred rT -> Simpl_Pred T Arguments Preim {T rT}%type_scope _%function_scope
Pred0 = fun T : Type => [Pred _ | False] : forall T : Type, Simpl_Pred T Arguments Pred0 {T}%type_scope
PredT = fun T : Type => [Pred _ | True] : forall T : Type, Simpl_Pred T Arguments PredT {T}%type_scope
sup_closure = fun (T : lattice) (s : Pred T) => [Pred p | forall t : Pred T, s <=p t -> t \In sup_closed -> p \In t] : forall T : lattice, Pred T -> Simpl_Pred T Arguments sup_closure {T}
dapp_chain : forall (A : Type) (T : A -> poset), chain (dfunPoset T) -> forall x : A, chain (T x)
